intro: Nunnezharia polita, commonly known as the smoothleaf nunnezharia, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, smooth-textured leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies for its purported anti-inflammatory effects.
